page.title: 03Tankersley church.
page.content:
There was a church on this site as early as 1085 A.D. Parts of this building,and of an even earlier saxon church,are still in evidence.
Every July there is a special service known as the 'Clippings'.Together with this service a fair is held with many different stalls and activities.
Each year the pupils of Tankersley Junior School are given a test on their knowledge of the New Testement.The four children with the best marks are awarded the Fenn Bible.The award is made at a special service at which the congregation join hands around the church and sing hymns.Inside the church a trumpeter plays from the balcony.
